content:
Yes, there are many documentaries out there that highlight the lives and legacies of influential individuals. Here are a few examples:

1. "Amy" (2015) - This documentary focuses on the life and career of Amy Winehouse, the acclaimed British singer who tragically died at the age of 27.

2. "RBG" (2018) - "RBG" is a biographical documentary film that chronicles the life and career of Ruth Bader Ginsburg, the 107th Supreme Court Justice and groundbreaking feminist icon.

3. "What Happened, Miss Simone?" (2015) - This documentary explores the life, career, and legacy of the legendary musician and activist Nina Simone.

4. "Jiro Dreams of Sushi" (2011) - This documentary profiles Jiro Ono, an 85-year-old sushi master who runs a tiny restaurant in a Tokyo subway station and is known as one of the greatest sushi chefs in the world.

5. "Man on Wire" (2008) - This documentary tells the story of French high-wire artist Philippe Petit's daring, illegal 1974 tightrope walk between the Twin Towers of the World Trade Center in New York City. 

These documentaries offer fascinating insights into the lives and careers of individuals who have made significant contributions to their fields and to society as a whole.
